column1: Topic title: Liow  DAP An Opportunistic Party Lacking Principle

column8: text

aZCOLmO9CbYWorking with former premier Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamed has shown that DAP is an opportunistic party that is lacking in principle, said MCA president Datuk Seri Liow Tiong Lai.He said that in July 2012, DAP adviser Lim Kit Siang had rallied the public not to follow Dr Mahathir’s political ideology.“He even pinpointed all of Dr Mahathir’s misdeeds in the country and asked the people to stop supporting him.“But this year, Lim is welcoming Dr Mahathir into the fold as the general election is approaching.“Welcoming Dr Mahathir, who is now Pakatan Harapan chairman, shows that DAP is an opportunistic party without principle.Cheers for the cheque: Liow (clapping) and Tan (third right) witnessing the handover from Carlsberg’s Lim Eng Wah (right) to school board chairman Chew Seng Chok (third left). “They would resort to all means just to win the general election,” said Liow during a press conference at SJKC Keong Kuang on Sunday.Liow urged the Chinese community to give MCA a chance to serve them.He said the party had a proven track record that would ensure the stability of the country.Earlier, Liow witnessed Carlsberg Malaysia presenting RM2.345mil to SJKC Keow Kuang. Penang MCA chairman Datuk Tan Teik Cheng was also present.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...g23Ag6uDbFW8.99
Liow, when will MaCAi start to abolish non-bumi policy?!?!Talk and make so much nonsense statement... Do him fell ashamed of himself ?!?!

A chance? Merdeka to 2008 tu apa?But to be fair during Mahathir time chinese were kept satisfied. Last time people were proud to be associated with MCA and they were filled with capable and dedicated members. Then after this Chua CD tookover he start to keep more wealth to himself and his cronies and thus angering a lot of grassroot members resulting in a lot of them leaving MCA..Now what's left of MCA are connected  opportunistic cronies and their families who still hanging on to any networking with government left for wealth.
